body: The `-logfile` flag is incompatible with `-no-restart`, as `-no-restart` disables the monitor process and it's the monitor process that implements `-logfile`. This is either a bug (i.e., it should work with both) or a user interface issue (i.e., we should reject the combination).
On windows I can't get it to work at all, but maybe thats a cygwin thing.
Hopefully, as the option was added specifically to support Windows :D

If you are using a OS-level process management / service manager, that should have the ability to write a logfile from stdout.
Also, you could just replace `-logfile=/var/log/syncthing.log` with `2>&1 >>/var/log/syncthing.log`. Only downside I know of is a not so easy log rotate.

issue.title: Logging not working
issue.body:
OSX, running v0.14.19 with the following command: `/usr/local/opt/syncthing/bin/syncthing -no-browser -no-restart -logflags=7 -verbose -logfile=/var/log/syncthing.log`

No log file is created, no matter what settings I use for `logfile` or `logflags`. Running the command from a shell shows the expected logging to stdout with the VERBOSE logging (when specified). It just never writes to the logfile. I have run this on multiple machines running El Capitan and Sierra with same results.

body: Syncthing doesn't do any sane log rotation on it's own either. The option was added mostly to aid in getting some logging running on Windows where syslog doesn't exist and piping wasn't always an option, IIRC. When running on something Unixy it's always better to pipe to syslog or let the process manager (systemd, launchd, smf, etc) handle the logging as it does best.
Actually scratch that, I have STNORESTART=1 in my .profile.

rename.to: The -logfile flag doesn't work together with -no-restart (STNORESTART=1)

body:
IMO, log rotation is not a critical offering of logging for a service like syncthing. That can easily be handled by logrotate, et al.

Also, using redirection - `2>&1 >>/var/log/syncthing.log` - does not work, as redirection is a shell-level function. I tried that exact configuration in the OSX service configuration (`plist`), and the service just crashes immediately. Doing the same thing within a shell script should work just fine, but that should be considered only a work-around, IMO.

If you're using launchd like it sounds like, you can let it do the logging:

```
<plist version="1.0">
	<dict>

...

		<key>StandardOutPath</key>
		<string>/Users/jb/Library/Logs/Syncthing.log</string>

		<key>StandardErrorPath</key>
		<string>/Users/jb/Library/Logs/Syncthing-Errors.log</string>
	</dict>
</plist>
```

Maybe we should add that to our template. Although launchd doesn't do any rotation either, which sucks.
Ah, that was my problem. Those paths are set to `/usr/local/var/log/syncthing.log`, and the proper logging settings are reflected in that file.

This hasn't quite made it to the live docs yet, but -no-restart means: `Disable the Syncthing monitor process which handles restarts for some configuration changes, upgrades, crashes and also log file writing (stdout is still written).`
https://github.com/syncthing/docs/pull/278/files
So I guess -logfile docs ought to have a mention about its evil twin -no-restart
Might be worth having syncthing tell you that those flags are incompatible if you try to use them together? Happy to do a PR if noone else cares.
Please do. If we can't make it work (which may be a little bit tricky), the least we can do is reject the invalid combination in the meantime.
This might be a procedural question, but shouldn't this be closed on merge rather than closed on Commit?
It was closed on merge. This projects merges PRs by squashing them onto master.
